newsitem.title: ITALY: Specialists bid for 73 bln lire of Italy BTPs.
newsitem.headline: Specialists bid for 73 bln lire of Italy BTPs.

text.p: Specialist bond traders bid for and were alloted 73 billion lire of 10-year fixed-rate bonds (BTP) against the Italian Treasury's offer of 150 billion lire of paper.
Earlier, the Treasury received bids for 3.387 trillion lire at the open auction for the November 1, 2006 bonds, against 1.5 trillion lire worth of paper on offer.
The auction price was set at 104.60 from 100.80 at the previous 10-year BTP sale on October 30, with a gross yield of 7.22 percent against 7.77 percent.
